entry.title: Electrum 2.0 has been tagged
entry.summary: In an email conversation, Thy Shizzle expressed admiration for BIP39. However, Aaron Voisine, co-founder and CEO of breadwallet.com, disagreed with this sentiment. While he acknowledged the compromise made to work on current generation low power embedded devices, he was concerned about the weak password key stretching and the fact that the wallet seed cannot be derived from the seed phrase. He considered these compromises to be a significant security risk. Despite his concerns, he understood the motivation behind the decision.
